publicationStmt.publisher: To the Reader: The English Preface in Print, c. 1475-1640 / Early English Books Online Text Creation Partnership

monogr.title: The historie of Samson: written by Fra: Quarles
monogr.author: Quarles, Francis

div.p:
〈1 page missing〉
for the time, but quickly leaves us to our former darknesse: The overtaken Lanthorne is the true Friend; which, though it promise but a faint light, yet it goes along with us, as farre as it can, towards our Journies end: The offered Linke is the mercenary Friend; which, though it be ready enough to doe us service, yet that service hath a servile relation to our bountie. Sir; in the middle ranke I finde you, hating the first, and scorning the last; to whom, in the height of my undissembled assection, and unfained thankfulnes, I commend my selfe, and this booke, to receive an equall censure, from your uncorrupted judgement: In the Bud, it was yours; it blossomd, yours; and now, your favour able acceptance confirmes the fruit yours: All I crave, is, that you would be pleased to interpret these my intentions
to proceed from an ardent desire, that hath long beene in labour to expresse the true affections of him
